GT.content: gift annulled each time there is restitution or countergift
GT.linkedContent: gift annulled each time there is restitution or countergift

GT.content: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance
GT.linkedContent: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance

GT.content: demand of gift/countergift, circulatory differance, requirement of restitution “at term,” delayed “due date,” thing itself demands gift & restitution
GT.linkedContent: demand of gift/countergift, circulatory differance, requirement of restitution “at term,” delayed “due date,” thing itself demands gift & restitution

GT.content: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift

GT.content: equivalence of taken & given is posed, thematized; the exemplarity of God (Maru) giving as much as he takes; tribe restores, restitutes equilibrium by following example
GT.linkedContent: equivalence of taken & given is posed, thematized; the exemplarity of God (Maru) giving as much as he takes; tribe restores, restitutes equilibrium by following example

GT.content: not through w/ this logic, one is never through w/ it
GT.linkedContent: not through w/ this logic, one is never through w/ it

SPOM.content: “[Hamlet] curses his mission: to do justice to a de-mission of time, he swears against a destiny that leads him to do justice for a fault, a fault of time and the times, by rectifying an address, a movement of correction, reparation, restitution, vengeance, revenge, punishment”
SPOM.linkedContent: “[Hamlet] curses his mission: to do justice to a de-mission of time, he swears against a destiny that leads him to do justice for a fault, a fault of time and the times, by rectifying an address, a movement of correction, reparation, restitution, vengeance, revenge, punishment”

PP.content: Plato imitates the imitator to restore the truth of what they imitate: that is, the truth itself [i.e. both Plato and sophists advise exercise of memory]
PP.linkedContent: Plato imitates the imitator to restore the truth of what they imitate: that is, the truth itself [i.e. both Plato and sophists advise exercise of memory]

PP.content: expulsion, sacrifice, exorcism of pharmakos played out on boundary line btwn inside/outside, expulsion of evil or madness to restore sōphrosunē
PP.linkedContent: expulsion, sacrifice, exorcism of pharmakos played out on boundary line btwn inside/outside, expulsion of evil or madness to restore sōphrosunē

ROP.content: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn
ROP.linkedContent: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn

ROP.content: reappropriate, restitute, reconstitute: to cling to thematic of simple, indivisible origin (both in Lacan and Heidegger)
ROP.linkedContent: reappropriate, restitute, reconstitute: to cling to thematic of simple, indivisible origin (both in Lacan and Heidegger)

ROP.content: Foucault: madness, evil genius, as a way to restitute lost truths in expression
ROP.linkedContent: Foucault: madness, evil genius, as a way to restitute lost truths in expression

PS.content: Artaud wants absolute restoration of proper to eve prior to all dissociation
PS.linkedContent: Artaud wants absolute restoration of proper to eve prior to all dissociation

TB.content: [re: Benjamin’s “The Task of the Translator”] translation as Aufgabe (task)—translator must acquit himself, is at fault, fallen, in error, perhaps a crime: task to render [think reddere rationem, Leibniz], and possible “reconciliation”: Wiedergabe, Sinnwiedergabe (restitution of meaning)
TB.linkedContent: [re: Benjamin’s “The Task of the Translator”] translation as Aufgabe (task)—translator must acquit himself, is at fault, fallen, in error, perhaps a crime: task to render [think reddere rationem, Leibniz], and possible “reconciliation”: Wiedergabe, Sinnwiedergabe (restitution of meaning)

DPi.content: vis-à-vis Benveniste, fraternal filiation as debt, as being condemned > fraternal duty to pay ransom: to acquit oneself of a debt
DPi.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Benveniste, fraternal filiation as debt, as being condemned > fraternal duty to pay ransom: to acquit oneself of a debt

DPi.content: fra-gildan, to render, restitute, ghildes, fraternities linked by common interest > require gold (Geld) for reconciliation, restitution
DPi.linkedContent: fra-gildan, to render, restitute, ghildes, fraternities linked by common interest > require gold (Geld) for reconciliation, restitution

REST.content: why always say painting renders, restitutes?
REST.linkedContent: why always say painting renders, restitutes?

REST.content: restitution: reestablishes in rights or property by placing subject upright again, “the erect body”
REST.linkedContent: restitution: reestablishes in rights or property by placing subject upright again, “the erect body”

REST.content: restitution: who’s the proper subject?
REST.linkedContent: restitution: who’s the proper subject?

REST.content: restitution, remise des chaussures, snares (ret) of these shoes formed by re- prefixes, revenir ——temptation to stand shoes upright again, to return them to authentic subject: la structure de la chose et du procès oblige, alors, toujours, à en rajouter (to keep adding to it) > to put back becomes a supplementary retortion, delirious dramaturgy > these shoes are hallucinogenic
REST.linkedContent: restitution, remise des chaussures, snares (ret) of these shoes formed by re- prefixes, revenir ——temptation to stand shoes upright again, to return them to authentic subject: la structure de la chose et du procès oblige, alors, toujours, à en rajouter (to keep adding to it) > to put back becomes a supplementary retortion, delirious dramaturgy > these shoes are hallucinogenic

REST.content: by owing the truth, one restitutes it, identifying as assigning points or proper size (pointure)
REST.linkedContent: by owing the truth, one restitutes it, identifying as assigning points or proper size (pointure)

REST.content: rendering homage [restitution?] is difficult, because of the “interminable outbidding of an analysis which is never finished tying together,” > and yet, il y a hommage, ça donne
REST.linkedContent: rendering homage [restitution?] is difficult, because of the “interminable outbidding of an analysis which is never finished tying together,” > and yet, il y a hommage, ça donne

REST.content: restitution as reattachment, lacing up, putting to work
REST.linkedContent: restitution as reattachment, lacing up, putting to work

REST.content: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest
REST.linkedContent: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest

REST.content: Derrida asks himself, “are you rendering justice to, restituting, Heidegger’s truth?” he responds, “question is too early, I’m just starting” [not exact quotes]
REST.linkedContent: Derrida asks himself, “are you rendering justice to, restituting, Heidegger’s truth?” he responds, “question is too early, I’m just starting” [not exact quotes]

REST.content: Heidegger’s subtraction of the product-work to get to the naked thing will not restitute the “remainder” to us as a “naked” thing: must “think” remainder otherwise
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s subtraction of the product-work to get to the naked thing will not restitute the “remainder” to us as a “naked” thing: must “think” remainder otherwise

REST.content: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly
REST.linkedContent: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly

REST.content: painting as detachment that loses its footing, says nothing of mise-en-abyme: mise-en-abyme as restituting saturation > “painting in painting”
REST.linkedContent: painting as detachment that loses its footing, says nothing of mise-en-abyme: mise-en-abyme as restituting saturation > “painting in painting”

REST.content: there’s a reattachment always, already, in process of retightening the unstrictured > les souliers font marquer (font marcher, font marché-de), shoes make move, make a market, are bigger than the frame ——the detached must also be understood as “representative mission to be reattached to its origin of emission” [father-son]
REST.linkedContent: there’s a reattachment always, already, in process of retightening the unstrictured > les souliers font marquer (font marcher, font marché-de), shoes make move, make a market, are bigger than the frame ——the detached must also be understood as “representative mission to be reattached to its origin of emission” [father-son]

REST.content: Shapiro’s restitution brings a ghost back alive to a dead man, mais revenant, revenant vivant au mort: dès lors vivant, lui-même revenant, who is himself then a ghost returning, “personal object” coming back to the ghost (revenant au revenant)
REST.linkedContent: Shapiro’s restitution brings a ghost back alive to a dead man, mais revenant, revenant vivant au mort: dès lors vivant, lui-même revenant, who is himself then a ghost returning, “personal object” coming back to the ghost (revenant au revenant)

REST.content: sacrifice in memory of another dead man, who [Goldstein] remains stony, like his name, mais revient aussi, comme un revenant, grâce au don de ce revenant
REST.linkedContent: sacrifice in memory of another dead man, who [Goldstein] remains stony, like his name, mais revient aussi, comme un revenant, grâce au don de ce revenant

REST.content: putting shoes on acc. its own size (sa pointure)? unconscious of Shapiro/Heidegger puts something of his own (sien) in them? > no, à la pointure du fantôme (the ghost’s size), of the unconscious of the other, in the final account (tout compte fait)
REST.linkedContent: putting shoes on acc. its own size (sa pointure)? unconscious of Shapiro/Heidegger puts something of his own (sien) in them? > no, à la pointure du fantôme (the ghost’s size), of the unconscious of the other, in the final account (tout compte fait)

REST.content: kettle logic: restituting a kettle
REST.linkedContent: kettle logic: restituting a kettle

REST.content: police, Shapiro, Dupin, restitution
REST.linkedContent: police, Shapiro, Dupin, restitution

REST.content: “clearly” & “evidently” do not implicate clarity but necessity to deny intrinsic obscurity of the thing—deny its essential crypt
REST.linkedContent: “clearly” & “evidently” do not implicate clarity but necessity to deny intrinsic obscurity of the thing—deny its essential crypt

REST.content: for Shapiro, parousia of Van Gogh: the shoes are him > hoc est corpus meum, sacrificial offering of his flesh
REST.linkedContent: for Shapiro, parousia of Van Gogh: the shoes are him > hoc est corpus meum, sacrificial offering of his flesh

REST.content: lowly shoes levitate, il élève jusqu’à la figure, transfigured shoes (haloes of themselves) look up toward most high: the Face [by way of restitution]
REST.linkedContent: lowly shoes levitate, il élève jusqu’à la figure, transfigured shoes (haloes of themselves) look up toward most high: the Face [by way of restitution]

PPT.content: restitution vs. representation: 1) restitution: truth itself restored, in person, w/out mask or veil > truth of truth 2) representation: adequation (not unveiling)—relief of original’s effigy
PPT.linkedContent: restitution vs. representation: 1) restitution: truth itself restored, in person, w/out mask or veil > truth of truth 2) representation: adequation (not unveiling)—relief of original’s effigy

ATM.content: the trap of obeying Levinas in restituting nothing, one becomes deaf to his obligation, but it only feels like a trap when inclined toward mastery, when one pretends to escape from absolute dissymmetry
ATM.linkedContent: the trap of obeying Levinas in restituting nothing, one becomes deaf to his obligation, but it only feels like a trap when inclined toward mastery, when one pretends to escape from absolute dissymmetry

OG.content: nonprohibition of proper name as consciousness which restitutes or discovers irremediable impropriety of proper names
OG.linkedContent: nonprohibition of proper name as consciousness which restitutes or discovers irremediable impropriety of proper names

OG.content: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]
OG.linkedContent: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]

OG.content: Rousseau fascinated by the copyist, produces sign of signs, always tempted to add supplementary signs to improve restitution of original—the good copyist must resist [baby daddy]
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau fascinated by the copyist, produces sign of signs, always tempted to add supplementary signs to improve restitution of original—the good copyist must resist [baby daddy]

OG.content: though Rousseau doesn’t make “travail de la mort,” play of difference, & operation of negativity serve in dialectical accomplishment of Hegel’s truth w/in horizon of parousia > still, a horizon of infinite restitution of presence [in Rousseau]
OG.linkedContent: though Rousseau doesn’t make “travail de la mort,” play of difference, & operation of negativity serve in dialectical accomplishment of Hegel’s truth w/in horizon of parousia > still, a horizon of infinite restitution of presence [in Rousseau]

EU.content: re: translating Descartes “back” into Latin: restitution, reconduire to original language, restoration to writing & law (droit)
EU.linkedContent: re: translating Descartes “back” into Latin: restitution, reconduire to original language, restoration to writing & law (droit)

EU.content: if original (French) already possesses translating structure, already refers to translation of original, it is because Latin is the ordering, lawful language
EU.linkedContent: if original (French) already possesses translating structure, already refers to translation of original, it is because Latin is the ordering, lawful language

FV.content: Lacan (as Dupin) knows how to return to letter of Freud, knows how to find it where it is found (se trouve) for purposes of restitution
FV.linkedContent: Lacan (as Dupin) knows how to return to letter of Freud, knows how to find it where it is found (se trouve) for purposes of restitution

FV.content: dead king, Freud, only one to contract w/ himself, awaits restitution > restoration: carrying off last plume w/ his 1st hand [in dying, mobilizes many]: theory of the facteurs
FV.linkedContent: dead king, Freud, only one to contract w/ himself, awaits restitution > restoration: carrying off last plume w/ his 1st hand [in dying, mobilizes many]: theory of the facteurs
